page.title: 04Fishing in St.Combs (1)
page.content: At one time{fishing}was very important in{St.Combs}but today there are only about{30 fishermen}and{five boats}out of a population of 815.They fish from {Fraserburgh}and{Peterhead }harbours, (because ST.COMBS has no harbour), mostly for{white fish}like{Cod,Haddock and{Plaice}.These are caught with diesel powered boats between 60 and 90ft long using the{seine net}and the{pair trawl methods. Herring }and {Mackeral}are still caught today but in smaller amounts using the{Purse net}or the{pair trawl}methods. This was not always so,fifty years ago {Herring fishing}was most important. {Steam drifters}operating from Fraserburgh, Peterhead and Yarmouth caught the Herring with{drift}nets.At this time there was a{railway}running from{Fraserburgh}to{St.Combs.
